p: Antioxidant substances are abundantly present in plants in the form of phenolic compounds (e.g., phenolic acids, flavonoids, coumarins, tannins, and lignans), nitrogen compounds (e.g., alkaloids and amines), vitamins (vitamin E and vitamin C), terpenoids, and some other endogenous compounds [ 5â€“ 8]. These antioxidants protect cells against oxidative damage and thereby prevent the occurrence of chronic diseases such as diabetes, cancer, and cardiovascular diseases [ 9].
